components.name: Blueprint
components.description: An ancient weapon designed by the Entrati for use by their Necramechs. Primary fire siphons life essence from the target to fuel a devastating secondary fire. A heavy flamethrower with surprising range. Secondary fire launches three projectiles in a fan pattern that explode, leaving a damaging area of effect for a short duration.

components.description: A Necramech weapon-crafting component.

description: An ancient weapon designed by the Entrati for use by their Necramechs. Primary fire siphons life essence from the target to fuel a devastating secondary fire. A heavy flamethrower with surprising range. Secondary fire launches three projectiles in a fan pattern that explode, leaving a damaging area of effect for a short duration.

patchlogs.name: Echoes of the Zariman: Update 31.6
patchlogs.changes: Cortege charge reticle

patchlogs.name: Update 29.6.0: Orphix Venom!
patchlogs.fixes:
Cortege Supulchrax Skin
Both Voidrig/Bonewidow Necramechs, Morgha, and Cortege weapons can be purchased in the Market for Platinum. Necramech’s also have their own category in the Market!

patchlogs.name: Update 29.5: Deimos Arcana
patchlogs.changes:
Cortege Changes:
Added Punch Through to the Cortege’s primary fire against enemies (will not penetrate level geometry).

patchlogs.name: Heart of Deimos: Hotfix 29.0.8 + 29.0.8.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Cortege prompting to install a Gravimag first as opposed to a Catalyst. This weapon comes with a Gravimag pre-installed, it will only ask you for a Catalyst if you wish to add one.

patchlogs.name: Heart of Deimos: Hotfix 29.0.6
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Cortege doing incorrect Damage type in Heavy Weapon mode.

patchlogs.name: Heart of Deimos: Hotfix 29.0.4
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed certain icons being reversed for repaired Cortege Receiver / Stocks.

patchlogs.name: Heart of Deimos: Update 29
patchlogs.fixes:
*Find the Cortege Blueprint as well as its Components from the Necraloid Syndicate.
*As outlined in a recent Dev Workshop, all new weapons in the update are starting with a minimum Riven disposition of 0.5. This includes the new Archgun weapons, Mausolon and Cortege. Archgun Riven dispositions have not been rebalanced in the past, but they will be included in our quarterly changes going forward, starting with the next Prime Access!

patchlogs.name: Garuda Prime: Update 31.3
patchlogs.changes: Awash in crimson and shimmering gold, Garuda Prime has emerged! Add Garuda Prime, exclusive Prime Accessories, Weapons, Boosters and more with Prime Access, or earn Relics in-game to craft Garuda Prime, Nagantaka Prime and Corvas Prime in your Foundry.

patchlogs.name: Update 17.7
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed an issue with various Archwing parts not being included in Archwing Mission Droptables (Corvas, Fluctus).

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 15.3.3
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed the Corvas charge shot not having any additional effect or damage.

patchlogs.name: Orphix Venom: Hotfix 29.6.6

patchlogs.name: Orphix Venom: Hotfix 29.6.2
patchlogs.changes: Fixed the Prisma Dual Decurion being untradeable.

patchlogs.name: Update 29.6.0: Orphix Venom!
patchlogs.fixes:
Fixed issues with Baro’s new Prisma Dual Decurions having [PH], missing icons, and the wrong texture when used as a Heavy Weapon. 
Fixed the Prisma Dual Decurions not having the intended 2 V polarities by default.

patchlogs.name: Warframe Revised: Railjack Revisited (Part 1): Update 27.4
patchlogs.changes: Recoil reduced for Dual Decurions in space.

patchlogs.name: Operation: Scarlet Spear: Titania Prime 27.3.6
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed losing Melee functionality after Deploying then swapping the Dual Decurions.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 15.5.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Dual Decurion blueprint appearing in Clan Tech, removed blueprint from Clan Tech Research. This is a Market blueprint for you to craft once you obtain the parts!

patchlogs.name: Update 29.10.0: Corpus Proxima & The New Railjack
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Clients not being able to reliably hit weak-points on enemies (such as the Orphix) with weapons that have sweeping projectiles such as the Fluctus.

patchlogs.name: Orphix Venom: Hotfix 29.6.2
patchlogs.changes: Fixed performance issues with the Fluctus.

patchlogs.name: Update 29.5: Deimos Arcana
patchlogs.changes: Reworked the Fluctus muzzle and projectile FX.

patchlogs.name: Warframe Revised: Railjack Revisited (Part 1): Update 27.4
patchlogs.fixes:
Fixed the Fluctus Arch-Gun’s stats not indicating that it has ‘Infinite’ punch-through. Go forth and punch-through all of the things, Tenno! 
Fixed the Rahk Fluctus skin on ground Arch-gun flickering between it and the default skin when being viewed by another player.

patchlogs.name: Warframe Revised: Update 27.2.0
patchlogs.changes: Increased the speed of Corvas and Fluctus projectiles to fix them dying before reaching their intended falloff ranges.

patchlogs.name: Buried Debts: Update 24.4.0
patchlogs.additions: Added extra spicy FX to Heavy Weapon equip of the Grattler and Fluctus.
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed the Fluctus looking fuzzy when equipped.

patchlogs.name: Fortuna: Hotfix 24.2.8
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed performance issues caused by leaking Fluctus impact FX.

patchlogs.name: Fortuna: Hotfix 24.2.7 + 24.2.7.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed the Fluctus ignoring Nullifier bubbles when using it in Atmosphere mode.

patchlogs.name: Fortuna: Hotfix 24.2.4
patchlogs.changes:
Fixed the Fluctus’ Atmosphere Arch-Gun FX appearing when in a Archwing mission, which was aggressively bright and overwhelming. 
Fixed missing Fluctus Atmosphere Arch-Gun summon sound.

patchlogs.name: Fortuna: Mesa Prime - Hotfix 24.2.3
patchlogs.changes: Lowered spawn chances and max simultaneous counts of Nullifier Shield Ospreys and the Fluctus carrying Terra Manker during the Profit-Taker end fight.

patchlogs.name: Update 21: Chains of Harrow
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed being unable to deal damage to the Jordas Golem from certain angles with the Fluctus.

patchlogs.name: Oberon Prime: Hotfix 20.7.3
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed being unable to deal damage to the Jordas Golem from certain angles with the Fluctus.

patchlogs.name: Oberon Prime: Hotfix 20.7.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed the Fluctus not doing any damage to turrets or buttons in the Jordas Verdict.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 17.9.2
patchlogs.changes: Reduced camera shake created by Fluctus projectiles.

patchlogs.name: Update 17.7
patchlogs.fixes:
Fixed some instances of the Fluctus not properly doing damage to enemies.
Fixed an issue with various Archwing parts not being included in Archwing Mission Droptables (Corvas, Fluctus).

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 17.6.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed the Fluctus not doing any damage to the J-3 Golem.

patchlogs.name: Update 15.10.0
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed elemental damage Mods not increasing damage when applied to the Fluctus.

patchlogs.name: Update 15.8.0
patchlogs.fixes: 3 BATTLE POINTS: Eyes of Blight Skin Pack (Badge + Rahk Fluctus Skin)

patchlogs.name: Update 15.7.2 + 15.7.2.1
patchlogs.fixes: Start your Research for the Itzal and Fluctus in the Clan Dojo, and purchase the blueprint for the Centaur from the Marketplace today!

components.name: Blueprint
components.description: Shatter your targets with explosive shells from this devastating Archwing cannon.

components.name: Forma
components.description: This shape-altering component is fundamental to Orokin construction. Allows you to change the polarity of a mod slot on a Warframe, Companions or Weapon and then resets their affinity to Unranked. This can only be used on max Rank Warframes, Companions and Weapons.

components.name: Oxium
components.description: Oxium is a rare lighter than air alloy of Orokin origin, used in certain Corpus Robotics.Locations: Venus, Jupiter, Mars, Neptune, Pluto, Eris, Europa, and Lua.

components.name: Salvage
components.description: High value metals collected from war salvage.Locations: Mars, Jupiter, and Sedna.

components.name: Tellurium
components.description: This rare metal is foreign to the Origin System and can only be found in asteroids that have made the long journey from other stars.Locations: Archwing Missions on Uranus.

description: Shatter your targets with explosive shells from this devastating Archwing cannon.
name: Grattler

patchlogs.name: Veilbreaker: Revenant Prime: Hotfix 32.0.9
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Kahl’s Boltor Grattler doing inconsistent damage to the Wolf of Saturn Six when aiming under his feet in the Prison Break mission.

patchlogs.name: Veilbreaker: Hotfix 32.0.7
patchlogs.fixes:
Fixed Kahl losing the ability to use the Grattler after dropping it by switching to his Grakata and then dying in the Veilbreaker Quest. 
Fixed leaving your Grakata on the ground after picking up the Grattler in the Veilbreaker Quest.

patchlogs.name: Veilbreaker: Hotfix 32.0.1
patchlogs.changes: Fixed an additional Bolkor Grattler appearing when the original held by Kahl runs out of ammo.

patchlogs.name: Sisters of Parvos: Hotfix 30.5.4
patchlogs.fixes: Normalized the Kuva Grattler Arch Gun stats with Heavy Weapon as intended and exposed said stats in the Arsenal:

patchlogs.name: Sisters of Parvos: Hotfix 30.5.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed duplicate instances of Kuva Grattler in Profile and Codex.

patchlogs.name: Call of the Tempestarii: Update 30
patchlogs.fixes:
Made optimizations towards the Grattler FX that were affecting GPU time.
We’ve also scaled down the Grattler projectile size to further improve performance.

patchlogs.name: Warframe Revised: Railjack Revisited (Part 1): Hotfix 27.4.3
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Grattler projectiles sometimes immediately exploding when fired which sometimes resulted in a crash.

patchlogs.name: Warframe Revised: Railjack Revisited (Part 1): Hotfix 27.4.1
patchlogs.changes: Removed self-damage when in space. The Grattler will apply the self-stagger mechanic now while in space.

patchlogs.name: Warframe Revised: Railjack Revisited (Part 1): Update 27.4
patchlogs.changes:
Proximity fuse has been added to Grattler rounds in space so they explode when they are near a target.
Polished the Grattler Heavy Gun’s fire and reload animations. Also fixed an errant animation that played when equipped.

patchlogs.name: Warframe Revised: Hotfix 27.2.2
patchlogs.changes: Grattler: 50%

patchlogs.name: Warframe Revised: Update 27.2.0
patchlogs.changes: Increased the Grattler projectile lifetime so it can reach its intended falloff range.

patchlogs.name: Buried Debts: Update 24.4.0
patchlogs.additions: Added extra spicy FX to Heavy Weapon equip of the Grattler and Fluctus.

patchlogs.name: Fortuna: Hotfix 24.2.5
patchlogs.changes: Increased Grattler Ammo capacity from 180 to 210 in Atmosphere Arch-Gun.

patchlogs.name: Update 17.1.0 - 17.1.4
patchlogs.changes:
• Increased the Grattler’s ammo capacity.
• Adjusted explosion radius on the Grattler’s projectile impact.
patchlogs.fixes: • Fixed the Grattler’s audio not functioning correctly when fired.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 17.0.5
patchlogs.changes: Grattler round explosions now deal damage.

patchlogs.name: Update 17: Echoes Of The Sentient
patchlogs.changes: Grattler

patchlogs.fixes: Fixed the Imperator Vandal preview not showing up in the Codex if you do not own it.

patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Imperator GPU particles moving towards the camera.

patchlogs.name: Empyrean: Ivara Prime 27.0.7
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Fulmin (only when reduced to below 10 rounds on Semi-Auto firing mode), Flux Rifle, Kitguns with the 'Gaze' Chamber type and Pax Charge Arcane, Imperator/Vandal, Cycron, and Larkspur not recharging correctly.

patchlogs.changes: Performance improvements related to firing the Imperator.

patchlogs.name: Fortuna: Hotfix 24.2.6
patchlogs.changes: Fixed the Imperator and Imperator Vandal reload sounds playing non-positional.

components.description: Sweep aside hordes of enemies with flaming fury of this powerful, automatic, grenade launching archgun.

description: Sweep aside hordes of enemies with flaming fury of this powerful, automatic, grenade launching archgun.

patchlogs.name: Update 32.2.0: Lua’s Prey
patchlogs.changes:
Fixed Kahl’s Kuva Ayanga displaying ammo numbers despite having infinite ammo. 
Fixed a duplicate Kuva Ayanga appearing on the ground after mounting a Rampart in the Junk Run mission.

patchlogs.name: Echoes of Veilbreaker: Update 32.1
patchlogs.changes: Fixed losing the Salvaged Kuva Ayanga for the rest of the Junk Run mission if you use the Hellion Jetpack after picking it up.

patchlogs.name: Veilbreaker: Revenant Prime: Hotfix 32.0.13
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed animation issue when Kahl is running with the Salvaged Kuva Ayanga.

patchlogs.name: Nidus Prime & Plague Star: Hotfix 30.7.5
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Kuva Ayanga firing projectiles back on the player with maximum Fire Rate.

patchlogs.name: Update 29.5: Deimos Arcana
patchlogs.changes: Removed Kuva Ayanga arming distance from projectiles.
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed the Kuva Ayanga dealing self damage.

patchlogs.name: The Steel Path: Inaros Prime 28.2.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed the Kuva Ayanga missing its handle animations.

patchlogs.name: Warframe Revised: Railjack Revisited (Part 1): Hotfix 27.4.4
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed the Kuva Ayanga causing self-damage when out in space.

patchlogs.name: Warframe Revised: Hotfix 27.2.2
patchlogs.changes: Kuva Ayanga: 50%

patchlogs.name: Empyrean: Update 27
patchlogs.changes: Increased projectile speed of the Kuva Ayanga while in space.

patchlogs.name: The Old Blood: Hotfix 26.0.7
patchlogs.changes:
Reduced the camera shake of the Kuva Ayanga explosions.
Fixed Kuva Lich weapons that do damage on both impact and explosion (Kuva Ogris, Kuva Ayanga, etc) doing significantly less overall damage than expected. This was due to the Elemental bonus only being applied to the "on impact" of the projectile itself and not the explosion.

patchlogs.name: The Old Blood: Hotfix 26.0.6 + 26.0.6.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Valence Transfer not applying to the Kuva Shildeg and Kuva Ayanga.

components.name: Blueprint
components.description: Reconfigured for maximum lethality, the Kuva Grattler still shatters targets with explosive shells, but now reaches maximum fire-rate instantaneously.

description: Reconfigured for maximum lethality, the Kuva Grattler still shatters targets with explosive shells, but now reaches maximum fire-rate instantaneously.

patchlogs.name: Sisters of Parvos: Hotfix 30.5.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed duplicate instances of Kuva Grattler in Profile and Codex.

components.name: Blueprint
components.description: From death blooms the Larkspur. A unique and menacing Archgun with a wild initial attack that locks onto a target then chains other targets close to the first. It also sports an explosive projectile mode. In Hildryn's grip the Larkspur carries more reserve ammo.

components.name: Crisma Toroid
components.description: A device of undetermined function and origin. Prized by Vox Solaris and the Quills.Earn Crisma Toroids by defeating the Profit-Taker Orb.

components.name: Radiant Zodian
components.description: Polished and cut to perfection.Blueprint sold by Smokefinger in Fortuna, Venus.

components.name: Synathid Ecosynth Analyzer
components.description: A processing unit that efficiently monitors environmental data.Acquired by disassembling Synathid Servofish.

components.name: Venerdo Alloy
components.description: A compound formed from Venerol.Blueprint sold by Smokefinger in Fortuna, Venus.

description: From death blooms the Larkspur. A unique and menacing Archgun with a wild initial attack that locks onto a target then chains other targets close to the first. It also sports an explosive projectile mode. In Hildryn's grip the Larkspur carries more reserve ammo.
name: Larkspur

patchlogs.name: Corpus Proxima & The New Railjack: Hotfix 29.10.5
patchlogs.changes: Fixed when Hildryn exits and re-enters the Railjack with Larkspur equipped as her Archwing Weapon, the max Artillery/Missile count will increase by 300, allowing the accumulated missiles to increase past their intended cap.

patchlogs.name: Update 29.10.0: Corpus Proxima & The New Railjack
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed the Larkspur beam (when used as a Heavy Weapon) occasionally not dealing damage to Nullifier bubbles.

patchlogs.name: Nightwave Series 3: Glassmaker: Hotfix 27.5.3
patchlogs.changes: The Larkspur now has force feedback when using a controller.

patchlogs.name: Warframe Revised: Railjack Revisited (Part 1): Hotfix 27.4.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Larkspur not showing Lead Indicator when it is in Alt-Fire Mode.

patchlogs.name: Warframe Revised: Railjack Revisited (Part 1): Update 27.4
patchlogs.changes: Reduced the collision size of Larkspur's Alt Fire projectile.

patchlogs.name: Warframe Revised: Hotfix 27.2.2
patchlogs.changes: Larkspur: 60%

patchlogs.name: Empyrean: Ivara Prime 27.0.7
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Fulmin (only when reduced to below 10 rounds on Semi-Auto firing mode), Flux Rifle, Kitguns with the 'Gaze' Chamber type and Pax Charge Arcane, Imperator/Vandal, Cycron, and Larkspur not recharging correctly.

patchlogs.name: Saint of Altra: Update 25.7.0
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Larkspur beams lagging behind when flying in Archwing.

patchlogs.name: Plains of Eidolon Remaster: Update 24.6.0
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Larkspur’s Alt Fire not functioning for Clients.

patchlogs.name: Buried Debts: Hotfix 24.5.5
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed the Larkspur having infinite Ammo as an Atmosphere Archgun after pressing the deploy button twice without letting go of the continuous fire.

patchlogs.name: Buried Debts: Hotfix 24.5.2
patchlogs.fixes:
Fixed the Larkspur not having the Archwing symbol in the Arsenal, which made sorting by name incorrect.
Fixed a script error when viewing Larkspur in the Arsenal.

patchlogs.name: Buried Debts: Hotfix 24.4.4 + 24.4.4.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed incorrect scaling on the Larkspur FX when used in Submersible missions.

patchlogs.name: Buried Debts: Update 24.4.0
patchlogs.changes: Larkspur can be acquired in the Market and in the Tenno Lab Clan Research.

components.description: Mandonel fires Radiation Damage projectiles. Partially charged shots release a spread and fully charged shots release a beam that dissolves into a radiation field. Projectiles that pass through the field are empowered.

components.description: The quietest and most elusive of Voidtongue utterances. Sought after but never found by Albrecht.Location: Albrecht's Laboratories (Deimos)

description: Mandonel fires Radiation Damage projectiles. Partially charged shots release a spread and fully charged shots release a beam that dissolves into a radiation field. Projectiles that pass through the field are empowered.
name: Mandonel

description: An ancient weapon designed by the Entrati for use by their Necramechs. Primary fire siphons life essence from the target to fuel a devastating secondary fire. Punishing automatic primary fire and a secondary mode that charges up to unleash a destructive beam of energy with a large explosion at point of impact.
name: Mausolon

patchlogs.name: Lua’s Prey: Hotfix 32.2.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed the Battacor’s alt-fire, Mausolon, and Trumna causing self damage instead of self stagger.

patchlogs.name: Echoes of the Zariman: Update 31.6
patchlogs.changes: Mausolon charge reticle

patchlogs.name: Zephyr & Chroma Prime Vault: Hotfix 31.5.9
patchlogs.fixes: For example, using weapons like Ferrox or Mausolon was impacting the shield and causing detonation visuals and sometimes staggering or knocking you down.

patchlogs.name: Update 30.5: Sisters of Parvos
patchlogs.changes: Ammo Chain will now give Mausolon 1800 Ammo pool instead of 1799.

patchlogs.name: Orphix Venom: Hotfix 29.6.4
patchlogs.changes: A mistake in that script caused players to receive extra copies of the Mausolon gun (which comes with Crafting/Claiming a Necramech in the Foundry), but without increasing your number of Archwing Weapon inventory Slots to hold them. This caused players who had already filled up their Inventory Slots to receive an error message that said "Invalid slots: Contact support" when trying to build a new Necramech or Archwing weapon. Selling the excess Mausolons you received would only temporarily suppress this error because as soon as you built another Arch-gun, you would again own more Arch-guns than you owned Inventory Slots.

patchlogs.name: Orphix Venom: Hotfix 29.6.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed an issue where some accounts got bonus duplicate Mausolons. Feel free to sell or use these if you were one of these players!

patchlogs.name: Update 29.5: Deimos Arcana
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed the Mausolon primary fire AoE not causing self-tagger.

patchlogs.name: Heart of Deimos: Hotfix: 29.2.4: NIGHTS OF NABERUS!
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Force Feedback issues when firing the Mausolon.

patchlogs.name: Heart of Deimos: Hotfix 29.0.2
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed inability to Chat link the Mausolon.

patchlogs.name: Heart of Deimos: Update 29
patchlogs.fixes: *As outlined in a recent Dev Workshop, all new weapons in the update are starting with a minimum Riven disposition of 0.5. This includes the new Archgun weapons, Mausolon and Cortege. Archgun Riven dispositions have not been rebalanced in the past, but they will be included in our quarterly changes going forward, starting with the next Prime Access!

components.name: Blueprint
components.description: Blast through enemies with a double-barreled shot of energized slugs. This siphons their life essence which is then used to generate the secondary fire's massive air-burst mortar. The ancient Entrati weapon was built for Necramechs but also functions as an Archgun.

patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Morgha Arsenal stats showing as red when no Mods are equipped.

patchlogs.name: Call of the Tempestarii: Update 30
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed audio issues with the Morgha Alt Fire.

patchlogs.name: Update 29.6.0: Orphix Venom!
patchlogs.fixes:
Morgha Supulchrax Skin
Both Voidrig/Bonewidow Necramechs, Morgha, and Cortege weapons can be purchased in the Market for Platinum. Necramech’s also have their own category in the Market!

patchlogs.name: Deimos: Arcana: Hotfix 29.5.3
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Morgha primary fire consuming more ammo than intended when used with Archwing.

patchlogs.name: Update 29.5: Deimos Arcana
patchlogs.changes: *Acquire the Morgha Blueprint and the required parts from Loid for Necraloid Standing!

patchlogs.name: Heart of Deimos: Hotfix 29.0.7
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed missing Phaedra Magazine when used as a Heavy Weapon.

patchlogs.name: Heart of Deimos: Hotfix 29.0.6
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Phaedra missing its Magazine component.

patchlogs.name: Warframe Revised: Railjack Revisited (Part 1): Update 27.4
patchlogs.changes: Phaedra accuracy increased.

patchlogs.name: Update 17.7
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed the Phaedra not having proper audio FX.

patchlogs.name: Update 17.5: The Jordas Precept. + Hotfix 17.5.1
patchlogs.additions: Phaedra: Devastate free-space enemies with Phaedra, the Soma’s big-sister.

description: Colder than space and less forgiving, Prisma crystals bring elite efficiency to the already sleek Dual Decurion. Requiring the lightest of touches to reload, these twin archguns prove that heavy weaponry can still possess elegance.
name: Prisma Dual Decurions

patchlogs.name: Nightwave: Nora’s Choice: Update 30.6.0
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed the Prisma Dual Decurions not appearing in the Codex and unable to Chat Link.

patchlogs.name: Orphix Venom: Hotfix 29.6.6
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed the description of the Prisma Dual Decurions being the same as the regular one.

patchlogs.name: Update 29.6.0: Orphix Venom!
patchlogs.fixes:
Fixed issues with Baro’s new Prisma Dual Decurions having [PH], missing icons, and the wrong texture when used as a Heavy Weapon. 
Fixed the Prisma Dual Decurions not having the intended 2 V polarities by default.

description: When fully charged, the magnetized barrel of the Velocitus accelerates a metal slug to tremendous speeds, piercing hulls and obliterating armor.
name: Velocitus

patchlogs.name: Warframe Revised: Railjack Revisited (Part 1): Update 27.4
patchlogs.changes: Increased size of Velocitus projectile in space.

patchlogs.name: Plains of Eidolon Remaster: Update 24.6.0
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Critical Focus not applying to charged shots (e.g. Velocitus).

patchlogs.name: Buried Debts: Update 24.4.0
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed crash when opening a Chat-linked Velocitus while in the Vehicles Arsenal.

patchlogs.name: Update: Lunaro
patchlogs.fixes: •    Fixed a script error when exiting the water with a Velocitus equipped.

patchlogs.name: Update 18: The Second Dream
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed players being able to damage a Fomorian Core multiple times with a single shot using the Velocitus.

patchlogs.name: Update 15.7.2 + 15.7.2.1
patchlogs.changes: Increased Velocitus’ damage from 1200 to 1800.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 15.5.6
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Velocitus weapon fire sound ending prematurely, also corrected various weapon fire animations.

patchlogs.name: Mesa Update
patchlogs.changes: Updated visual on Velocitus hit effect, increased visual distance of shot.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 15.2.1 +15.2.2
patchlogs.changes:
Updated Velocitus firing sounds.
Reduced lens flare effect on Velocitus.
Bigger hit effect on the Velocitus’ projectile.
Small buff to Velocitus’ damage, included ability to sweep a sphere giving some ‘slack’ on the shot.

patchlogs.name: Update 15.2.0
patchlogs.additions: When fully charged, the magnetized barrel of the Velocitus accelerates a metal slug to tremendous speeds, piercing hulls and obliterating armor.
